intro: Bumelia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican bumelia, is a shrub or small tree native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Bumelia mexicana is often found in dry, rocky soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
